text:
Philippe Rahmy (5 June 1965 – 1 October 2017) was a Swiss poet and writer. He was born in Geneva, Switzerland. He was a founding member of the prominent French literary site remue.net which focused on promoting contemporary literature over the Internet and through live events. He also worked as a photographer and as a director of award-winning independent short movies.
In 2017, he won the Swiss Literature Award.
Rahmy died of complications from brittle bone disease in Geneva on 1 October 2017 at the age of 52.
